alert.note: Alert for East Washington Central Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 16 at 2:50PM PDT until July 17 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...DRY, WINDY CONDITIONS INTO MONDAY... .The passage of a dry cold front will break down the hot ridge of high pressure and bring critical fire conditions to much of central and eastern Washington through Monday. Hot southerly winds will be found this evening across central and north central Washington. Winds will shift to the west and northwest overnight. Expect strong westerly winds across central and eastern Washington on Monday in the wake of a dry cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT MONDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EAST WASHINGTON CENTRAL CASCADES... * Affected Area: Fire Weather Zone 696 East Washington Central Cascades (Zone 696). * Winds: West to northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts around 25 mph this evening. On Monday, Northwest 12 to 24 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidities: 10 to 25 percent through early evening. Monday: 20 to 35 percent in the valleys and 30 to 40 percent over the higher terrain locally near 60 percent along the Cascade Crest. * Impacts: Main concerns for critical fire weather conditions on Monday will be east of the cascade crest. Any new and existing fires have the potential to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
